section.title: What is HPE Helion OpenStack
section.p: HPE Helion OpenStack is a commercial distribution built on OpenStack technology that provides an open, scalable, highly available enterprise-grade cloud software platform to help customers build, manage, and consume hybrid clouds.

section.title: What does HPE Helion OpenStack enable me to do?
section.p: You have consistently given us feedback to release a distribution of OpenStack technology - fully tested, hardened and supported by HP. With this version, you can deploy a cloud with a minimum of 8 nodes and up to 100 nodes and have the ability to experience OpenStack technology.

section.title: What is TripleO?
section.p: OpenStack-on-OpenStack or TripleO, is an official OpenStack project for deployment of OpenStack systems. It builds on the core resource-provisioning strengths of OpenStack technology. It enables you to administrate your cloud, and deploy and maintain virtual and baremetal installations of OpenStack using the same APIs you are familiar with for deploying workloads on an OpenStack cloud. A template-based deployment engine (using OpenStack Heat) allows for rigorous testing and reliable, repeatable deployments of known configurations.
A TripleO installation includes a seed, the undercloud and the overcloud.

section.title: What is a seed?
section.p: A seed VM is a bootable KVM VM image provided as part of HPE Helion OpenStack and is deployed in a VM instance. This image contains the minimum services required of OpenStack to function and to be able to provision physical hardware to deploy the undercloud. The services are Nova, Neutron, Glance, Keystone, Ironic & Heat.
This is the first phase of the HPE Helion OpenStack installation.

section.title: What is the undercloud?
section.p: The undercloud server is a basic single-node OpenStack installation running on a single physical server used to deploy, test, manage, and update the overcloud servers. There is no HA configuration for the undercloud.

It contains a strictly limited sub-set of OpenStack just enough to interact with the overcloud. The services running on the undercloud are Nova, Neutron, Glance, Keystone, Ironic, Heat, Horizon & Ceilometer. This server also contains HPE Helion content distribution catalog service, which provides a mechanism to download and install content and updates for the overcloud.

The undercloud also hosts images for various server types which will form the functional cloud environment - the overcloud. These images are overcloud Controller, overcloud Compute, overcloud Swift & overcloud Compute Proxy (required for clouds that support VMWare ESX as a hypervisor).
This is the second phase of the HPE Helion OpenStack installation.

section.title: What is the overcloud?
section.p: The overcloud is the functional cloud available to run guest virtual machines and workloads. It offers access to the Nova, Neutron, Glance, Keystone, Cinder, Swift, Ironic, Heat, Horizon, and Ceilometer services.
Setting up the overcloud completes the overall HPE Helion OpenStack installation process.

section.title: Is the release localized for non-English speaking markets?
section.p: No. The 2014 release is English only.

section.title: Does HPE Helion OpenStack work with hybrid or public cloud projects?
section.p: No. Currently, HPE Helion OpenStack is supported by HPE for small-scale, private cloud deployments only.

section.title: How many nodes and virtual machines does it support?
section.p: HPE Helion OpenStack will support up to 100 nodes and 40 VMs per node.

section.title: How can I update the software?
section.p: HPE provides automated, live distribution of updates.

section.title: Does HPE Helion OpenStack include an Operating System (OS)?
section.p: Yes. It includes an integrated Linux host OS hardened and tested for this distribution.

section.title: Does this distribution include the OpenStack Icehouse release?
section.p: Yes, and HPE is one of the first vendors to release a supported, productized distribution based on Icehouse, HPE Helion OpenStack Community.

section.title: Can HPE Helion OpenStack run on non-HPE hardware?
section.p: Yes, provided the hardware meets the minimum specifications. We will continue to work to develop a list of third-party hardware on which the distribution is known to run.

Where can I report issues with HPE Helion OpenStack
section.p: To report issues with HPE Helion OpenStack please visit http://www.hpe.com/support/hpsc.
